titleStmt.title: A blast blown out of the north and ecchoing up towards the south to meet the cry of their oppressed brethren being a relation of some of the sufferings and other exercises of several of the people of God, in scorn called Quakers, in and about Richmond, Massam, Coverdale, Wensleydale, and Swaledale, and some others of the adjacent parts and places in the North Riding of the county of York since the beginning of the year 1660.
titleStmt.author: R. R. (Richard Robinson), b. 1628?

notesStmt.note: "To the reader" signed: R.R. [i.e., Richard Robinson]. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of original in Friends' Library, London.
